translated: Biography of Governor Cunhui
Governor Cunhui, whose taboo name was Cunhui, was styled Chaoyuan. He was called Huaiqiyi. He had a warm heart for literature and martial arts since childhood.
He combined the sincerity of being both lenient and stern. He helped people together. He was good at riding horses and shooting with a bow.
But the gibbons cried first. He was quite familiar with the art of warfare. But he was unrestrained and free.
Therefore, he was able to enter the ranks of his peers.
He turned and twisted, surpassing the ordinary people.
Wherever he lived, he was promoted.
He alone stood out among the many scholars.
Everyone agreed with the selection.
Many people were recommended. He bathed in the favor of the ruler. He was cautious in his search.
He was then promoted to the rank of official. He did not take notes.
The office was clear and feared people's knowledge.
He yielded the treasure, surpassing the former sages.
His contentment surpassed the later generations.
He thought that within the gate of the carriage, he would divide.
The ruler's worries in the state and prefecture.
He set up strategies to assist the country.
How could he have expected the earth and fire to secretly turn their backs?
The spiritual nature returned to the eternal void.
Leaving behind the skin and flesh of King Liu Bai.
I have not heard the beautiful words of the golden man.

He examines and investigates in the state and prefecture.
His divine strategies are evident on the border.

In front of the courtyard, he sees no one.
The officials all cry in motion.
